blank:
blank()
    Renders a blank screen.

    Examples
    --------
    > blank();

    See Also
    --------
    next, nextSlide, prev, prevSlide, redraw
currentSlide:
currentSlide
    Returns the current presentation slide index.

    The returned index is the nominal (i.e., one-based) slide index.

    Returns
    -------
    idx: integer
        Current presentation slide index.

    Examples
    --------
    > currentSlide

    See Also
    --------
    jumpTo, next, numSlides, prev
end:
end()
    Jumps to the last fragment of the last slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > end();

    See Also
    --------
    first, jumpTo, last, next, prev
first:
first()
    Jumps to the first slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > first();

    See Also
    --------
    end, jumpTo, last, next, prev
firstFragment:
firstFragment()
    Jumps to the first fragment of the current slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > firstFragment();

    See Also
    --------
    lastFragment, next, prev
jump:
jump( n )
    Jumps a specified number of slides.

    Parameters
    ----------
    n: integer
    	Number of slides to jump.

    Examples
    --------
    // Jump two slides forward:
    > jump( 2 );

    // Jump two slides backward:
    > jump( -2 );

    See Also
    --------
    jumpTo, next, prev
jumpTo:
jumpTo( n )
    Jumps to a specified slide, where `n` is the nominal slide number.

    Parameters
    ----------
    n: integer
    	Nominal slide number (one-based).

    Examples
    --------
    > jumpTo( 2 );

    See Also
    --------
    jump, next, prev
last:
last()
    Jumps to the last slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > last();

    See Also
    --------
    end, first, jumpTo, next, prev
lastFragment:
lastFragment()
    Jumps to the last fragment of the current slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > lastFragment();

    See Also
    --------
    firstFragment, next, prev
loadPresentation:
loadPresentation( file )
    Loads a presentation from a file.

    Relative file paths are resolved relative to the current working directory.

    Parameters
    ----------
    file: string
    	File path.

    Examples
    --------
    > loadPresentation( './path/to/presentation.txt' );

    See Also
    --------
    reloadPresentation
next:
next()
    Moves the presentation to the next slide or slide fragment.

    Examples
    --------
    > next();

    See Also
    --------
    first, jumpTo, last, nextSlide, prev
nextSlide:
nextSlide()
    Moves the presentation to the next slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > nextSlide();

    See Also
    --------
    first, jumpTo, last, next, prev, prevSlide
numSlides:
numSlides
    Returns the presentation length.

    Returns
    -------
    len: integer
        Number of slides.

    Examples
    --------
    > numSlides

    See Also
    --------
    currentSlide, jumpTo, next, prev
pres:
pres()
    Prints presentation help text and shortcuts.

    Examples
    --------
    > pres();

    See Also
    --------
    help, info
prev:
prev()
    Moves the presentation to the previous slide or slide fragment.

    Examples
    --------
    > prev();

    See Also
    --------
    first, jumpTo, last, next, prevSlide
prevSlide:
prevSlide()
    Moves the presentation to the previous slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > prevSlide();

    See Also
    --------
    first, jumpTo, last, next, nextSlide, prev
redraw:
redraw()
    Redraws the current presentation slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > redraw();

    See Also
    --------
    next, nextSlide, prev, prevSlide, reloadPresentation
reloadPresentation:
reloadPresentation( file )
    Reloads a presentation.

    Examples
    --------
    > reloadPresentation();

    See Also
    --------
    loadPresentation, redraw
renderSlide:
renderSlide()
    Renders the current presentation slide.

    Examples
    --------
    > renderSlide()

    See Also
    --------
    load
runSlide:
runSlide()
    Runs slide code.

    Examples
    --------
    > runSlide()

    See Also
    --------
    next, prev
unwatch:
unwatch( [error] )
    Stops watching a presentation file for changes.

    Parameters
    ----------
    error: Error (optional)
    	Error object.

    Examples
    --------
    > unwatch();

    See Also
    --------
    loadPresentation, redraw, reloadPresentation, watch
watch:
watch()
    Watches a presentation source file for changes.

    "Renaming" a source file is *not* tracked. If a source presentation file is
    renamed, watching stops.

    Examples
    --------
    > watch();

    See Also
    --------
    loadPresentation, redraw, reloadPresentation, unwatch
